COMMON_REG
[IINCHIP_REG]

Detailed Description

COMMON register group
It set the basic for the networking.
It sets a configuration such as interrupt, network information, memory allocation, etc.
And it includes registers from IR to IDR.

See also:
IR, IMR : Interrupt

SHAR, GAR, SUBR, SIPR : Network information

RTR, RCR : Data retransmittion

TMS01R, TMS23R, TMS45R, TMS67R, RMS01R, RMS23R, RMS45R, RMS67R, MTYPER : Memory allocation

PATR, PTIMER, PSIDR, PDHAR : PPPoE

UIPR, UPORTR, FMTUR : ICMP message

Pn_BRDYR, Pn_BDPTHR : PIN 'BRDYn' Configuration

IDR : W5300 ID

Define Documentation

#define FMTUR   (COMMON_REG_BASE + 0x4E)

Fragment MTU register.

RESET : 0x0000
When communicating with a peer having a different MTU, iichip can receive an ICMP(Fragment MTU) packet.
At this case, IR(IR_FMTU) becomes '1' and destination IP address and fragment MTU of the received ICMP packet can be acquired through UIPR and FMTUR.
In order to communicate with the peer continously, set the FMTUR to Sn_MSSR of the SOCKET, and then try to communicate again.

RESET : 0x5300

Definition at line 528 of file w5300.h.

Referenced by getIDR().

#define IMR   (COMMON_REG_BASE + 0x04)

Interrupt mask register.

RESET : 0x0000
It configures the interrupt of W5300 to notify the host.
Each interrupt mask bit of IMR corresponds to each interrupt bit of IR.
When any bit of IR is set as '1' and its corresponding bit of IMR is also set as '1', interrupt is issued to the host.

Definition at line 192 of file w5300.h.

Referenced by getIMR(), and setIMR().

#define IR   (COMMON_REG_BASE + 0x02)

Interrupt register.

RESET : 0x0000
It is the register to notify W5300 interrupt type to the Host.
If any interrupt occurs, its related bit is set as '1'.
When its related mask bit is '1', b\ '/INT' signal is asserted low. '/INT' keeps low until all bits of IR becomes '0'. If all bits of IR become '0', it becomes high de-assert.
In order to clear its higher bits(15-8) which is set as '1', the host should write the bit as '1'.
In case of its lower bits(7~0) which is set as '1', it is automatically cleared when clearing the related bit of Sn_IR.

Each bit of IR defines as the following.

  • IR_IPCF : 7 bit of IR's MSB
  • IR_DPUR : 6 bit of IR's MSB
  • IR_PPPT : 5 bit of IR's MSB
  • IR_FMTU : 4 bit of IR's MSB
  • IR_SnINT(n) : n bit of IR's LSB

Definition at line 178 of file w5300.h.

Referenced by getIR(), iinchip_irq(), and setIR().

#define MTYPER   (COMMON_REG_BASE + 0x30)

Memory type register.

'1' - TX memory
'0' - RX memory

RESET : 0x00FF
W5300's 128KBytes data communication memory (Internal TX/RX memory) is composed of 16 memory blocks of 8KBytes.
MTYPER configures type of each 8KB memory block - RX or TX. The type of 8KB memory block corresponds to each bit of MTYPER.
When the bit is '1', it is used as TX memory, and the bit is '0', it is used as RX memory. MTYPER is configured as TX memory type from the lower bit.
The rest of the bits not configured as TX memory, should be set as '0'.

See also:
TMS01R, RMS01R

Definition at line 353 of file w5300.h.

Referenced by sysinit().

#define PATR   (COMMON_REG_BASE + 0x32)

Authentication type register.

RESET : 0x0000
It notifies authentication method negotiated with PPPoE server. W5300 supports 2 types of authentication methods.

  • PAP : 0xC023
  • CHAP : 0xC223

For the detail, refer to 'How to use PPPoE in W5300.pdf'

Definition at line 369 of file w5300.h.

Referenced by getPATR().

#define PDHAR   (COMMON_REG_BASE + 0x40)

PPPoE destination hardware address register.

RESET : 0x0000
It notifies hardware address of PPPoE server (acquired by PPPoE-process of W5300).
For the detail, refer to 'How to use PPPoE in W5300.pdf'

#define PMAGICR   (COMMON_REG_BASE + 0x38)

PPP LCP magic number register.

RESET : 0x--00
It configures byte value to be used for 4Bytes 'Magic number' during LCP negotiation with PPPoE server.
For the detail, refer to 'How to use PPPoE in W5300.pdf'

Definition at line 397 of file w5300.h.

Referenced by getPMAGICR(), and setPMAGICR().

#define Pn_BDPTHR ( n   )     (COMMON_REG_BASE + 0x60 + n*4 + 2)

PIN 'BRDYn' buffer depth Register.

RESET : 0xUUUU
( 0 <= n <= 3 )

It configures buffer depth of PIN 'BRDYn'.
When monitoring TX memory and Sn_TX_FSR is same or bigger than Pn_BDPTHR, the PIN 'BRDYn' is signaled.
When monitoring RX memory and Sn_RX_RSR is same or bigger than Pn_BDPTHR, PIN 'BRDYn' is signaled.
The value for Pn_BDPTHR can't exceed TX/RX Memory size allocated by TMSxyR or RMSxyR .

Definition at line 518 of file w5300.h.

Referenced by getPn_BDPTHR(), and setPn_BDPTHR().

#define Pn_BRDYR ( n   )     (COMMON_REG_BASE + 0x60 + n*4)

PIN 'BRDYn' configure register.

RESET : 0x--00
( 0 <= n <= 3 )

It sets the PIN 'BRDYn' which is monitoring TX/RX memory status of the SOCKET.
If the free buffer size of TX memory is same or bigger than the buffer depth of Pn_BDPTHR, or received buffer size of RX memory is same or bigger than the Pn_BDPTHR, PIN 'BRDYn' is signaled.

Each bit of Pn_BRDYR defines as the following.

  • Pn_PEN : 7 bit
  • Pn_MT : 6 bit
  • Pn_PPL : 5 bit
  • Pn_SN(n) : 2~0 bit

Definition at line 500 of file w5300.h.

Referenced by getPn_BRDYR(), and setPn_BRDYR().

#define PSIDR   (COMMON_REG_BASE + 0x3C)

PPPoE session ID register.

RESET : 0x0000
It notifies PPP session ID to be used for communication with PPPoE server (acquired by PPPoE-process of W5300).
For the detail, refer to 'How to use PPPoE in W5300'

Definition at line 413 of file w5300.h.

Referenced by getPSIDR().

#define PTIMER   (COMMON_REG_BASE + 0x36)

PPP link control protocol request timer register.

RESET : 0x--28
It configures transmitting timer of Link Control Protocol (LCP) Echo Request. Value 1 is about 25ms.

Definition at line 385 of file w5300.h.

Referenced by getPTIMER(), and setPTIMER().

#define RCR   (COMMON_REG_BASE + 0x1E)

Retransmittion retry count reigster.

RESET : 0x--08
It configures the number of retransmission count.
When retransmission occurs as many as 'RCR+1' counts, Timeout interrupt is issued to the host.

See also:
RTR, IR, Sn_IR

Definition at line 280 of file w5300.h.

Referenced by getRCR(), and setRCR().

#define RMS01R   (COMMON_REG_BASE + 0x28)

Transmit memory size of each SOCKET reigster.

RESET : 0x0808
RMSxyR configures each internal RX memory size of SOCKETx and SOCKETy
RX memory size of each SOCKET is configurable in the range of 0~64KBytes. 8Kbytes is assigned when reset.
Total size of each socket's RX memory should be the multiple of 8.

See also:
TMS01R, MTYPER

Definition at line 321 of file w5300.h.

Referenced by sysinit().

#define RTR   (COMMON_REG_BASE + 0x1C)

Retransmittion timeout-period register.

RESET : 0x07D0
It configures Retransmission Timeout-Period.
Value 1 is 100us.
RTR is initialized with 2000(0x07D0) and has 200ms timeout-period.

See also:
RCR

Definition at line 266 of file w5300.h.

Referenced by getRTR(), and setRTR().

#define SHAR   (COMMON_REG_BASE + 0x08)

Source hardware address register.

RESET : 00.00.00.00.00.00
It configures source hardware address (MAC address).

#define SIPR   (COMMON_REG_BASE + 0x18)

Source IP address register.

RESET : 0.0.0.0
It configures source IP address or notifies source IP address acquired by PPPoE-Process of W5300.

#define TMS01R   (COMMON_REG_BASE + 0x20)

Transmit memory size of each SOCKET reigster.

RESET : 0x0808
TMSxyR configures each internal TX memory size of SOCKETx and SOCKETy
TX memory size of each SOCKET is configurable in the range of 0~64Kbytes. 8Kbytes is assigned when reset.
Total size of each SOCKET's TX memory should be the multiple of 8.

See also:
RMS01R, MTYPER

Definition at line 295 of file w5300.h.

Referenced by sysinit().

#define UIPR   (COMMON_REG_BASE + 0x48)

Unreachable IP address register.

RESET : 0.0.0.0
When trying to transmit UDP data to destination port number which is not open, W5300 can receive ICMP (Destination port unreachable) packet.
In this case, IR(IR_DPUR) becomes '1'. And destination IP address and unreachable port number of ICMP packet can be acquired through UIPR and UPORTR.

Definition at line 444 of file w5300.h.

Referenced by getUIPR(), and iinchip_irq().

#define UPORTR   (COMMON_REG_BASE + 0x4C)

Unreachable port number register.

* RESET : 0x0000
Refer to UIPR.
